concept.title: Log Formats
concept.shortdesc: When you use the Log data format, you can read log files that use the following log formats:

dlentry.dd: A standardized text format used by web servers to generate log files. Also known as the NCSA (National Center for Supercomputing Applications) Common Log or Access Log format.
A customizable text format based on the common log format and optional additional details. Also known as the NCSA Combined Log Format.
The error log format generated by the Apache HTTP Server.
A customizable access log generated by the Apache HTTP Server. Use the Apache syntax to indicate the format of the log file.
Use a regular expression to define the structure of log data, and then assign the field or fields represented by each group.
Use a grokmore info to come
A flexible format generated by the Apache Log4j logging utility. You can use the default format or specify a custom format.
When a log4j log event includes a stack trace, Directory treats the stack trace as a multiline field.
